lines.gurmukhi: AiDAwqm krm prmwqm prm pd qq imil qqih prmqq vwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Adhiaatam Karam Paramaatam Param Pada , Tat Mili Tatahi Paramatat Vaasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A rare Guru-conscious person attains the knowledge of spirituality through spiritual deeds and absorbs himself in Him as truth rejoins with Truth.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd ibbyk tyk eyk hI Anyk myk jMqR Duin rwg nwd AnBY AiBAwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Bibayk Tayk Ayk Hee Anayk Mayka , Jantr Dhouni Raag Naad Anabhai Abhiaasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As musical instruments produce melodious notes which also represent words in a song, so does a meditation practitioner merges in the fearless Lord who pervades in all and sundry.

lines.gurmukhi: drs iDAwn aunmwn pRwnpiq Aibgiq giq Aiq AlK iblwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Daras Dhiaan Ounamaan Praanapati , Abigati Gati Ati Alakh Bilaasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As meditation renders all our breaths one with Lord- the granter of life, so would a Guru-conscious man be engrossed in Him by contemplating on Him and becomes capable of enjoying all His bliss by this union with Him.

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq ktwC idib dyh kY ibdyh Bey jIvn mukiq koaU ibrlo audwsI hY ]116]
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Kataachh Dibi Dayh Kai Bidayh Bhaay , Jeevan Moukati Kooo Biralo Udaasee Hai ?116?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the elixir-like divine glance of the True Guru, he becomes unconscious of his body (needs). Such a person with renounced and detached inclination is rare to come by. (116)
